Class ArrayReferenceVariable

  • java.lang.Object
    • p3System.Variable
      • p3System.ArrayReferenceVariable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Variable>

    public class ArrayReferenceVariable
extends Variable
    This class represents an array reference variable.

    samus250

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayReferenceVariable

        public ArrayReferenceVariable(java.lang.String name,
                              DataType type,
                              P1MemSystem p1Sys,
                              int address,
                              ArrayGarbageCollector arrayGC)
        Constructs an array reference variable with the required and given information.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the array reference variable.
        type - the type of the reference variable.
        p1Sys - the memory system of where this variable is being stored.
        address - the adddress where the variable is being stored in the memory system.
        arrayGC - an array garbage collector object.

      • ArrayReferenceVariable

        public ArrayReferenceVariable(java.lang.String name,
                              DataType type,
                              P1MemSystem p1Sys,
                              int address,
                              DataType arrayType)
        Constructs an array reference variable with the given and required information.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the array reference variable.
        type - the type of the reference variable
        p1Sys - the memory system where the array is located.
        address - the address of where this variable is located.
        arrayType - the type of the elements in the array.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
              throws InvalidValueException
        Description copied from class: Variable
        Stores the given value in the memory area assigned to the variable.
        Overrides:
        setValue in class Variable
        Parameters:
        value - the value to store.
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException - whenever the value is of invalid data type.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String value,
                     boolean modifyRCF)
              throws InvalidValueException
        Sets the value of the variable.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the reference variable (address of array).
        modifyRCF - true if the reference count field should be modified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException - whenever the given value is invalid.

      • decrementRCF

        public void decrementRCF()
        Decrements the reference count field of the array. If it reaches 0, it is sent to garbage collection.

      • setRCF

        public void setRCF(int r)
        Sets the reference count field of the array.
        Parameters:
        r - the reference count field of the array.
